content.description: Start left hand on edge and right hand on sloper just right of Eight Ball. Use pockets and make difficult move to top. Stay just right of Eight Ball. Frequently passed over in favor of Eight Ball, and because it is a less obvious line. A difficult "V2"
content.location: One of the first problems you see approaching the Eight Ball boulder on the way to the overlook point.

content.description: Sit start low in jugs. Climb face and top out on slopers.
content.location: Left side of eightball boulder. Middle of the three most doable/chalked looking spots. Several feet right of the leftmost corner.

content.description: Start on left corner as Brawn. Traverse to the right to days and finish as Circumcision top out. Pumpy YDS 5.12 perhaps.
content.protection: 2 pads/ 1 pad and spotter placed at top out.

content.description: Start in the middle of the face below the circular pockets on nice jugs. Make a couple moves on jugs to a good sloper at the lip, reach deep for a small rail, and top out straight up.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yu5nSPTjOaM
content.location: First one you see coming down the trail. About 6 ft left of the tree on obvious jugs.

content.description: Start on low holds, slightly awkward moves to better hands, and as per usual, awkward mantle.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. There is a small tree at the base of this problem so it might be nice to have two pads, one for the ground and one for the tree.
content.location: Behind thin tree that's just in the right spot to actually hit it when peeling off. Down climb on backside of boulder.

content.description: Start on jugs, make a long move up and left to a slopey crimp and top out via slopers. A hold broke on this problem and while the grade is unchanged it has increased in difficulty.
content.location: Farthest right problem on the Eight Ball Boulder next to a tree.

content.description: Sit start low in jugs and climb face to sloper top out.
content.location: Middle of left/broad face of eightball boulder.

content.description: Sit start low in jugs. Long moves to funky mantle. Not sure if things leftward are off.
content.location: Left arete/corner of left/broad side of eightball boulder.

content.description: Can be crowded later in the day, because though the sun is on several of the walls, the sunset from here is a great view. Good starting point if you want to steadily work your way back through the boulders.
